intro: Paranephelium chinense, commonly known as the Chinese mistflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable addition to woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its aromatic leaves and subtle floral display.
